title: John Burgess reveals how Twitter has revitalised his career
text:
He has been a staple on television screens for five decades.

And game show legend John Burgess is now making a comeback in the digital age, after earning himself a cult following on Twitter.

On Tuesday, the 76-year-old told Junkee: 'It really started out as an extension of the Burgo nonsense I've been peddling on radio and TV.'

Digital comeback! Burgo's Catch Phrase host John Burgess (pictured) revealed on Tuesday how Twitter has revitalised his career. Pictured on set of Wheel of Fortune

Since joining Twitter in 2009, the former Burgo's Catch Phrase and Wheel of Fortune host has gained a significant fanbase.

He is known for his wholesome dad jokes, which he regularly posts on a Friday.

John recently wrote: 'My wife hates me talking to her when we're out jogging, so she stuffs a handkerchief in my mouth.

'Well, I don't mind too much, with us, it's kind of a running gag!'

Classic Burgo! Since joining Twitter in 2009, John has earned himself a cult following. He is known for his wholesome dad jokes, which he regularly posts on a Friday

Another tweet read: 'Went to a restaurant last week and asked the waiter, "What's the catch of the day?"

'He said, "Rabbit". I said, "Doesn't the catch of the day refer to fish?" He replied, "Normally, but our dog can't swim!"'

In May this year, John also made the perfect Mother's Day joke.

'I hope everybody gives their mum a huge spoil today, they deserve it, they go through a lot for their kids,' he tweeted.

'I asked my mum if she had it all to do over, would she still have a child? She said, "Yes...but not the same one!"'

Comeback? Speaking to Junkee, John revealed he may be back on television sooner rather than later. Pictured with his Wheel of Fortune co-host Adriana Xenides, who died in 2010

In his interview with Junkee, John also revealed he may be back on television sooner rather than later.

'There has been some rumblings about a return of something I've done before, or maybe something new,' he said.

'Hopefully, in the not too distant future as my time is running out I reckon.'
description: He has been a staple on television screens for five decades.
authors: Shannon Shipley For Daily Mail Australia
